headline.print_headline: In Flashback to ’72, A’s Take Four Straight From Yankees
headline.seo: A’s Take Four Straight From Yankees
headline.main: In Flashback to ’72, A’s Take Four Straight From Yankees

docs.snippet: The Athletics became the first team in nine years to sweep a four-game series against the Yankees when Coco Crisp hit a game-winning single with one out in the bottom of the 12th....
docs.abstract: Oakland Athletics defeat New York Yankees, 5-4, in 12 innings, to become the first team in nine years to sweep a four-game series against the Yankees.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Athletics became the first team in nine years to sweep a four-game series against the Yankees when Coco Crisp hit a game-winning single with one out in the bottom of the 12th.

headline.print_headline: Venture Capital Firms, Once Discreet, Learn the Promotional Game
headline.seo: Venture Capital Firms, Once Discreet, Learn the Promotional Game
headline.main: Venture Capital Firms, Once Discreet, Learn the Promotional Game

docs.snippet: Venture capitalists are hiring full-time public relations experts to tell bloggers and reporters of their investing prowess....
docs.abstract: Venture capital firms, feeling stresses on the industry, are hiring full-time public relations experts to market their investing prowess, a shift for firms that have long operated in secret; many are following the example set by Andreessen Horowitz, a venture capital firm started by Netscape co-founder Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz.
docs.lead_paragraph: Venture capitalists are hiring full-time public relations experts to tell bloggers and reporters of their investing prowess.

headline.print_headline: Forrest S. McCartney, 81; Helped Revive Space Shuttle
headline.seo: Lt. Gen. Forrest S. McCartney, Former NASA Official, Dies
headline.main: Forrest S. McCartney, a Top NASA Official, Dies at 81

docs.snippet: General McCartney played a central role in developing military spy satellites and the MX intercontinental missile system before being appointed head of the Kennedy Space Center....
docs.abstract: Forrest S McCartney, retired Air Force lieutenant who who was appointed head of NASA's civilian-run Kennedy Space Center, dies at age 81.
docs.lead_paragraph: General McCartney played a central role in developing military spy satellites and the MX intercontinental missile system before being appointed head of the Kennedy Space Center.

headline.print_headline: In the Bronx, Plans for an Outlet Mall Offering High Fashion at a Discount
headline.seo: Upscale Outlet Mall Is Planned for the Bronx
headline.main: In the Bronx, Plans for an Outlet Mall Offering High Fashion at a Discount

docs.snippet: If built, the Lightstone Group project could be a drawing card for a city torn between celebrating haute couture and coveting the convenience of suburban malls....
docs.abstract: Lightstone Group's plans to build New York City's first upscale outlet mall in the Bronx could be a huge draw for shoppers who normally head upstate to the Woodbury Common Premium Outlets in Central Valley, NY; Lightstone has purchased a 19.2-acre property in the Ferry Point neighborhood for $30 million; feasibility of development is still being explored.
docs.lead_paragraph: If built, the Lightstone Group project could be a drawing card for a city torn between celebrating haute couture and coveting the convenience of suburban malls.

docs.snippet: Now that the Metropolitan Transportation Authority is selling advertising space on its MetroCards, a graphic designer offers some ad proposals....
docs.abstract: Op-Art by Chip Kidd offers ideas for ads in light of the news that the Metropolitan Transportation Authority will be selling advertising space on MetroCards.
docs.lead_paragraph: Now that the Metropolitan Transportation Authority is selling advertising space on its MetroCards, a graphic designer offers some ad proposals.

headline.print_headline: East River Trash Project Receives Federal Permit
headline.seo: Waste-Transfer Station in Manhattan Is Approved
headline.main: East River Trash Project Receives Federal Permit

docs.snippet: The 91st Street garbage transfer station would serve Manhattan, the only borough currently without one....
docs.abstract: Bloomberg administration says it has received final regulatory approval to build a garbage transfer station on the East River at East 91st Street; construction could begin by the end of the year on a project that has generated intense opposition on the Upper East Side; transfer station would serve Manhattan, the only borough currently without one.
docs.lead_paragraph: The 91st Street garbage transfer station would serve Manhattan, the only borough currently without one.

headline.print_headline: Cabrera’s Milestone Home Run Lifts Tigers
headline.seo: Cabrera’s 300th Homer Lifts Tigers Over White Sox
headline.main: Cabrera’s Milestone Home Run Lifts Tigers

docs.snippet: Miguel Cabrera became the second Venezuela-born player to reach 300 home runs....
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; Detroit Tigers infielder Miguel Cabrera hits his 300th career home run in team's 6-4 victory over Chicago White Sox; other results noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Miguel Cabrera became the second Venezuela-born player to reach 300 home runs.

headline.print_headline: In Scott’s Fall, Shades of Norman At the ’96 Masters
headline.seo: 2012 British Open — Adam Scott’s Collapse Recalls One by Greg Norman
headline.main: In Scott’s Fall, Shades of Norman at the ’96 Masters

docs.snippet: Adam Scott of Australia blew a four-shot lead with four holes to play at the 141st British Open, recalling his countryman Greg Norman’s collapse at another major years ago....
docs.abstract: Bill Pennington On Golf column; Australia's Adam Scott, who for years has told the story of how crushed he was when his idol and countryman Greg Norman blew a six-stroke lead in the final round of the1996 Masters, blows a four-shot lead with four holes to play at the British Open to finish second behind Ernie Els.
docs.lead_paragraph: Adam Scott of Australia blew a four-shot lead with four holes to play at the 141st British Open, recalling his countryman Greg Norman’s collapse at another major years ago.

headline.seo: Fashion Magazines in China, Laden With Ads, Are Thriving

docs.snippet: Publishers of fashion magazines willing to contend with censorship and various other hurdles in China are being rewarded with heavy advertising demand....
docs.abstract: Fashion magazine publishers who are willing to contend with censorship and various other hurdles in China are being rewarded with heavy advertising demand; many titles are adding to their advertising spending to take advantage of China's sixth-place world ranking for spending on luxury goods; industry sees growth in China while sales of such magazines are declining in the United States.

byline.original: By CHRISTINE HAUGHNEY and JONATHAN LANDRETH
byline.contributor: Christine Haughney reported from New York and Jonathan Landreth from Beijing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Publishers of fashion magazines willing to contend with censorship and various other hurdles in China are being rewarded with heavy advertising demand.

headline.print_headline: Pressure Grows in China to End One-Child Law
headline.seo: Pressure to Repeal China’s One-Child Law Is Growing
headline.main: Reports of Forced Abortions Fuel Push to End Chinese Law

docs.snippet: Accounts of women being coerced into late-term abortions by local officials have thrust a policy that penalizes families in China for having more than one child into the spotlight....
docs.abstract: Reports of women being coerced into late-term abortions by local officials have thrust China's population control policy into the spotlight and ignited an outcry from those wanting central officials to change the law that penalizes families for having more than one child; pressure to alter the policy is building among economists as well, who say that China's aging population and dwindling pool of young, cheap labor will be a significant factor in slowing the nation's economic growth rate.
docs.lead_paragraph: Accounts of women being coerced into late-term abortions by local officials have thrust a policy that penalizes families in China for having more than one child into the spotlight.
